alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Lake County; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 1:17PM PST until December 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY EVENING... Snow levels will gradually rise this afternoon and range from 2500 to 3500 feet. Heaviest snow continues across portions of Trinity County where an additional 4 to 8 inches is possible through this evening. Greater amounts are likely above 3500 feet. Precipitation rates will taper off during the evening but scattered rain and snow showers are likely through the night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow across elevations ranging from 2500 to 3500 will continue through early evening. An additional 4 to 8 inches are possible. Locally, lower elevation communities could see 2 to 4 inches. Precipitation rates will taper off overnight but scattered rain or snow showers are likely through morning. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California interior above 2500 feet in elevation. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult...especially over higher passes along Highways 3, 36 and 299. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
